why: This is the quintessential anime flick for me.
I've always loved this movie, it's the perfect combination of funny and poignant. I still get choked up when young Patrick says 'Lady Iris...'.
This is my favorite of the bizarre Wes Anderson flicks, complete with David Bowie songs performed in Portugese! The closing credits cast walk-off to 'Queen Bitch' is simply brilliant.
I'm not as philosophical as some people about this movie. I just like quotes such as 'We need guns. Lots of guns.'
The interplay between the French Officer (Jean Gabin) and German Prison Commander (Eric von Stroheim) is amazing. The perfect depiction of 'the end of an era', from chivalry to modern war.
Kurosawa is one of my favorite directors, and this is probably his masterpiece. Inspiration for many films that came after it.
The role George C. Scott was born to play. The scene where he recalls an ancient battle (the Battle of Zama) as if he was there still gives me goosebumps.
David Bowie as Goblin King. Need one say more? Includes memorable lines such as: 'Just let me rule you, and I will be your slave'.
The one that started it all, and where Lucas is still excited about making movies.
It's rare for an animated film to catch me by surprise with its poignancy, and this really got to me in the first 10 minutes. After that I was willingly along for the ride.
